description.value:
Trigger The number of PCs in the eastern half of the hallway equals or exceeds the number in the western half

Effect The eastern side of the hallway floor tilts at a 45-degree angle, its end descending. Any creature standing in this section of the hall must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:43] save to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Grab an Edge]. On a failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Prone], tumbles eastward down the length of the ramp, and falls 30 feet into a chamber beneath the hall (area B4b), taking @Damage[(3d12+15)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save). A PC within 10 feet of the hallway's eastern end when it tilts can instead attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:40] save to scramble into area B5. A PC who fails this check instead tumbles and rolls all the way down the steeply sloped ramp before plummeting into area B4b.

stealth.details: (master) to notice the hallway is constructed to tilt on a hinge point halfway down its length

details.description: Images of excessive feasts decorate the walls of the hallway.
details.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43] (expert) to jam the hallway so it can't tilt; a character who succeeds at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:46] or @Check[athletics|dc:46] check can balance or sprint the length of the hallway before it has a chance to tilt. Flying creatures and Tiny creatures don't trigger the trap. Creative solutions (such as loading the hallway's western half with an appropriate counterweight) might also disable the trap.
details.reset: Once the weight in the eastern end of the hallway is removed, the ramp rises back to its original position and the trap immediately resets.
